confession.seduction_date: Multiple versions: 1 year before (1598), 15 years before (1584), during first marriage
confession.seduction_context: Initially claimed seduction 1 year before when angry about hail damage to vines. Under torture changed to 15 years before when child fell in fire and was burned - given white ointment to cure child for 2 deniers payment

witnesses.name: Philippe son of the late Demenge Tisserand
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: lived in same house, attempted business transaction

testimony.quarrel_subject: Land sale dispute - vineyard purchase of 45 francs, Didie withdrew after being told Philippe couldn't pay
testimony.threat_quote: par la mort diable he should not have the land

testimony.quarrel_subject: Claudon Mongin threatened to have her burned as witch
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle n'en craindoit dieu ny le monde

testimony.quarrel_subject: family dispute when brother and son visited

witnesses.name: Gaitte femme au sieur Nicolas Gellée

testimony.quarrel_subject: Demenge Pourlat (husband) complained about her cooking, particularly veal that made him ill
Husband complained she would give poison rather than good soup
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle estoit plus femme de bien au pertuix de son cul que ledit Mongin n'estoit au plus beau de son visage
witches who died without being burned were damned
que c'estoit une diable de femme, qu'elle luy donroit plustost la damnation que la salvation

witnesses.name: Claudon Mongin
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Philippe's master, landlord of same house

testimony.quarrel_subject: Philippe's illness - threatened to cut her throat if she didn't remove illness

witnesses.name: Barbe femme Jean Duprey le jeune

testimony.quarrel_subject: Didie refused to let husband take prescribed purgation

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after he failed to mend a window for her

testimony.quarrel_subject: Marital discord - husband drank in tavern all day then fell into bed in stupor

timeline.subject: Procureur Fiscal of comté de Blamont
timeline.details: Procureur states he heard about young man vomiting strange substances after quarrel with Didie. Requests imprisonment and investigation for blasphemy, witchcraft, and daughter's statement about rebaptism

timeline.subject: Philippe son of Demenge Tisserand
timeline.details: Deposition taken from Philippe about illness following quarrel over vineyard sale

timeline.subject: Multiple witnesses
timeline.details: 29 witness depositions taken over several days beginning May 12

timeline.subject: Didie Pourlatte
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses - no additional material

timeline.subject: Didie Pourlatte
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for question extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Didie Pourlatte
timeline.details: Change de Nancy orders she should only be threatened with torture at this stage

timeline.subject: Didie Pourlatte
timeline.details: Began to confess before seeing instruments. Named accomplices. Multiple retractions and renewals of confession

timeline.subject: Didie Pourlatte
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for torture again

timeline.subject: Didie Pourlatte
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to torture same day

timeline.subject: Didie Pourlatte
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture. Gave inconsistent timeline of seduction (15 years vs 1 year). Confessed to sabbat attendance, making fogs to spoil crops, naming accomplices, and various malefices

timeline.subject: Didie Pourlatte
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Didie Pourlatte
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to death sentence

timeline.subject: Didie Pourlatte
timeline.details: Formal sentence by echevins of Blamont

timeline.subject: Didie Pourlatte
timeline.details: Sentence carried out. Property confiscated and sold

methods: actual torture (methods not specified in detail)
torture.requesting_official: Procureur Fiscal of comté de Blamont
torture.restrictions: Initially ordered only to threaten with torture (June 2). Full torture approved June 11

accomplices_named.name: widow of Didier Virtemberg
accomplices_named.context: Named during first confession before seeing torture instruments

accomplices_named.name: man from Blamont with a 'pied fort'
Didie de Counay, wife of her brother Demenge Chanoine

prior_accusations.context: Multiple witnesses testified that people in Hallouille were glad to see her go, believing her to be a witch. Few people attended her wedding there

notable_quotes.speaker: Didie veuve Demenge Pourlatte
notable_quotes.french: aussy femme de bien que la Vierge Marye
notable_quotes.english: as good a woman as the Virgin Mary
notable_quotes.context: Blasphemous statement that triggered initial investigation

notable_quotes.speaker: Didie's brother from Hallouille
notable_quotes.french: que sy elle estoit femme de bien qu'elle maintienne son poinct, mais que sy elle estoit autre il vouldroit qu'elle fut desja bien loing
notable_quotes.english: if she was a good woman she should maintain her point, but if she was otherwise he wished she was already far away
notable_quotes.context: Response to her claim about being as good as Virgin Mary

notable_quotes.speaker: Didie veuve Demenge Pourlatte
notable_quotes.english: by the death of the devil
notable_quotes.context: Oath used when telling Philippe he would not have the vineyard

notable_quotes.speaker: Didie veuve Demenge Pourlatte
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle n'en craindoit dieu ny le monde
notable_quotes.english: that she feared neither God nor the world
notable_quotes.context: Response to Claudon Mongin's threat to have her burned as witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Didie veuve Demenge Pourlatte
notable_quotes.context: Offering her throat when Claudon Mongin threatened to cut it

notable_quotes.speaker: Didie veuve Demenge Pourlatte
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle estoit plus femme de bien au pertuix de son cul que ledit Mongin n'estoit au plus beau de son visage
notable_quotes.english: that she was more a good woman in the hole of her ass than said Mongin was in the best part of his face
notable_quotes.context: Crude insult directed at Claudon Mengin

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Pourlatte (her husband)
notable_quotes.french: que c'estoit une diable de femme, qu'elle luy donroit plustost la damnation que la salvation
notable_quotes.english: that she was a devil of a woman, who would give him damnation rather than salvation
notable_quotes.context: Husband's complaint when asked why wife didn't make him soup

notable_quotes.speaker: Didie veuve Demenge Pourlatte
notable_quotes.context: Coming out holding her rosary beads when family arrived

relationships.evidence_text: married Demenge le Lorrain when she was 18, and lived with him for 23 years, then 10 years as widow
Remarried with Demenge Pourlat, but this only lasted 20 months before his death
Was daughter of Mengin Chanoine and his wife Jehenne, of Hallouille
Was daughter of Mengin Chanoine and his wife Jehenne, of Hallouille
her son, Didier Saulnier, for 15 francs
her brother from Hallouille... Land at Hallouille was bought by her brother Demenge Chanoine for 100 francs
Didie de Counay, wife of her brother Demenge Chanoine
might have been given a mistaken reputation as a witch because of her sister-in-law, also called Didie, who was indeed much suspected
heard from mother-in-law Bernarde (veuve Jean Coustellier)
Didie, who lived in a room in same house
currently in service of Claudon Mengin cordonnier of Blamont
Gaitte femme au sieur Nicolas Gellée, lieutenant du prévôt
Jeanne la Menchotte of Repas, whose daughter had married Didie's son

economic_context.details: Central dispute involved sale of vineyard to Philippe for 45 francs in two installments. When others told Didie that Philippe couldn't pay, she withdrew from deal despite having received 'le denier dieu' (earnest money/binding payment). This quarrel directly preceded Philippe's illness. Property confiscation after execution: land at Hallouille sold to brother for 100 francs and son for 15 francs, personal property realized 38 francs

harms_catalog.harm_description: Completely lethargic and 'frenetique' for 9 days, then began vomiting strange things such as little knots of hair, stones, buttons of glass
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Vineyard sale dispute - Didie withdrew from 45 franc sale after being told Philippe couldn't pay
harms_catalog.method_alleged: black powder given by her master (devil)

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill, believed wife had poisoned him with veal, made 'ung mauvais bouqual', complained she would give him damnation rather than salvation
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Marital disputes - husband threw pan of fish across room, mentioned the veal; another time threw pot of soup on ground during quarrel about him going to tavern instead of working vines

harms_catalog.victim_name: Brother of Bernarde veuve Jean Coustellier
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He failed to mend a window for her
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after he failed to mend window

harms_catalog.harm_description: Confessed under torture to killing various animals
Fell in fire and was badly burned - later healed
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Not attributed to witchcraft - incident that allegedly led to seduction
harms_catalog.method_alleged: White ointment used for healing (allegedly obtained from devil for 2 deniers)

harms_catalog.harm_description: Made fogs to spoil crops at sabbat

Cooking pan thrown by husband
Prescribed by surgeon for husband's illness, Didie refused to let him take it
Allegedly given by devil to cure burned child, paid 2 deniers for it
Confessed to giving Philippe illness with black powder given by master (devil)
Seen planting beans on wet ground, appeared to keep feet in bowl and move where she pleased

spatial_references.context: Main location of trial, where accused lived and trial took place
Accused's place of origin, where she lived during first marriage. People there glad to see her go. Location of property sold after execution
Birthplace of Philippe, the main victim/witness
Location of Change de Nancy, the superior court that approved torture and death sentence
Referenced by witness Barbe - similar counter-magic case 14 years earlier where suspect was burned
Home of Jeanne la Menchotte, whose daughter married accused's son
Parish of Mre. Nicolle, curé who owned house where they lived
Location of monastery where Mre. Nicolle resided
Where Bernarde learned counter-magic remedy from chaplain. Suspect later executed there too

Residence of Sebille veuve Jean Mercier
Location associated with Didie de Counay, named accomplice
Confessed to being taken to sabbat, but said whole thing disappeared soon after arrival. Later said attended several times to make fogs
Blamont house where Didie, Philippe, and Claudon Mengin all lived in separate rooms
Where Philippe's bed was located when Didie came and sat by it
Husband allegedly spent whole day in tavern drinking instead of working vines

weather_events: hail damage to vines (trigger for alleged seduction confession)
animal_predation: strange cat believed to have been in room on second night of Philippe's illness

marital disputes over money and work
property disputes over vineyard payment ability
religious_calendar_references: Sunday evening referenced for family gathering

officials_named.name: Procureur Fiscal of comté de Blamont
Mre. Nicolle
officials_named.location: curé d'Amenoncourt, resident at monastery of Domevre

hearsay_chains.content: Incident when Demenge Pourlatte threw pan of fish across room, making remark about the veal
Surprised when Didie said no farewells to neighbours at Hallouille, heard things in village that made her unwilling to accompany her back

hearsay_chains.source: Barbelline, servant to widow of Claudon Cuguin
hearsay_chains.content: Accused asked if witches who died without being burned were damned
Daughter who married accused's son had frequent quarrels with mother-in-law and was frightened
People there were glad to see accused go, believing her to be a witch

hearsay_chains.reporter: Gaitte femme au sieur Nicolas Gellée
hearsay_chains.content: Incident when accused was frightened, said she was less fearful in country than in Blamont

hearsay_chains.reporter: Barbe femme Jean Duprey le jeune
hearsay_chains.source: memory of case at Lunéville 14 years earlier
hearsay_chains.content: Counter-magic remedy using objects from suspect placed in bed, suspect burned soon after

emotional_state_notes: defiant - said she feared neither God nor the world
fearful during work (multiple witnesses noted her being frightened by sudden noises)
confessed before seeing torture instruments out of fear
said confession induced by sergent's false promise of release

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Gave rational account of various episodes with Philippe's illness during confrontations
Contradicted herself about first husband beating her, first denied then admitted story
Said second husband was already ill when they married, denied causing his illness

third_parties.name: Demenge Pourlatte (second husband)
third_parties.context: Died after 20 months of marriage, believed wife bewitched him with veal, complained she was devil of woman who would give damnation not salvation

third_parties.name: Demenge le Lorrain (first husband)
third_parties.context: Married when she was 18, lived together 23 years, during this time allegedly seduced by devil (one version of confession)

third_parties.name: Demenge Chanoine (brother)
third_parties.context: From Hallouille, visited with son, told her if she was good woman maintain point but if otherwise wished she was far away. Bought her land for 100 francs after execution

third_parties.name: Didier Saulnier (son)
third_parties.context: Visited with uncle, married daughter of Jeanne la Menchotte of Repas. Bought land for 15 francs after execution

third_parties.name: Clemence (daughter)
third_parties.context: Age 17, allegedly wanted to be rebaptised. Interrogated and testified mother advised her to pray to God and cross herself. Saw no harm in mother

third_parties.name: Didie (sister-in-law)
third_parties.context: Much suspected of witchcraft, accused claimed she might have mistaken reputation because of her

third_parties.name: Didie de Counay
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: sister-in-law, wife of brother Demenge Chanoine

third_parties.name: Mother of Didie Pourlatte
third_parties.context: Strongly suspected of witchcraft according to multiple witnesses

third_parties.name: Bernarde veuve Jean Coustellier
third_parties.context: Accompanied son when he went to fetch Didie from Hallouille, surprised at her lack of farewells, heard things that made her unwilling to accompany her back

third_parties.name: Mre. Nicolle, curé d'Amenoncourt
third_parties.context: Owned house where they lived, told Pourlat he must leave because heard nothing good of his wife

third_parties.name: Jeanne la Menchotte
third_parties.context: From Repas, daughter married accused's son, reported girl had frequent quarrels with mother-in-law and was frightened

third_parties.name: widow of Didier Virtemberg
third_parties.context: Named as accomplice before seeing torture instruments

third_parties.name: man from Blamont with 'pied fort'
third_parties.context: Named as accomplice before seeing torture instruments

third_parties.name: chaplain of Baccarat
third_parties.context: Taught counter-magic remedy to Bernarde. Suspect later executed at Baccarat too

third_parties.name: sergent (guard)
third_parties.context: Accused claimed he falsely promised she would be released if she confessed

third_parties.name: governor
third_parties.context: Visited Philippe when he was sick

third_parties.name: brother of Bernarde
third_parties.context: Allegedly died after failing to mend window for accused

third_parties.name: child of Didie (burned in fire)
third_parties.context: Fell in fire and badly burned during first marriage, allegedly led to seduction when seeking cure. Healed with white ointment

extraction_metadata.notes: Rich trial record with extensive witness testimony (29 witnesses), detailed interrogation sequences, multiple confession retractions. Key features: blasphemy charge (comparing self to Virgin Mary), property dispute triggering accusations, complex confession sequence with changing timelines (1 year vs 15 years for seduction), torture used, accomplices named. Notable for husband's death from alleged poisoning and counter-magic remedies attempted. Extensive social network data from Hallouille and Blamont. Property confiscation details included.
